quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Shows and Year
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, massachusetts, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: William Moggridge is commonly credited with the creation of the first true laptop computer, in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1979

questions.question: Which one of these singers was not one of the original Supremes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cindy Birdsong

questions.question: Which two American cities boast statues of Popeye the Sailor?

options.text: Crystal City, Texas and Chester, Illinois
Petaluma, California and Palm City, Florida
Wiley, Texas and East St. Louis, Illinois

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crystal City, Texas and Chester, Illinois

questions.question: This person wrote what historians recognize as the worlds first computer program -- a method for calculating Bernoulli numbers with Charles Babbages analytical engine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord Byrons daughter

questions.question: What funds were used in the founding of the British Museum?

options.text: A single bequest of Lord Henry Dinsdale
Fund raising among the nobility of Europe

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: National Lottery

questions.question: Who played the role of Tommy in the 1975 movie Tommy”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Daltrey

questions.question: Felix Silla has been in many movies and TV shows, however, he played his most favourite role in this TV comedy show from 1964-1966.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Addams Family

questions.question: What alloy contains copper and zinc, with a content of copper typically more than 50%?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brass

questions.question: In 1960, a  #1 hit on the pop charts was the comedy song Please Mr. Custer, I Dont Wanna Go!. Whose song was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Larry Vernes

questions.question: American athletes Dave DeBusschere, Gene Conley and Del Rice all have what in common?

options.text: They played pro baseball and  pro football
They played pro basketball and pro football
They played pro basketball and became team owners
They played pro basketball and pro baseball

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They played pro basketball and pro baseball

questions.question: This Massachusetts born musical composer wrote Sleigh Ride, Holiday for Strings, The Typewriter and Plink, Plank, Plunk.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leroy Anderson

questions.question: This Louisville-born actor was called the busiest actor in Hollywood because he got so many roles in so many movies. His most famous roles were in Deliverance in 1972, Network  in 1976, and Superman in 1978.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ned Beatty

questions.question: The Luddites were a social movement of English workers, who protested against industrial revolution, because they felt that their jobs were threatened.  The movement, which was named after a mythical leader began in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1811

questions.question: It was one of the first TV shows for children.  It featured one human and many puppets, all worked by one man, Burr Tillstrom.  What was its name ?

options.text: Crusader Rabbit and Rags the Tiger

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kukla, Fran and Ollie

questions.question: What is the next number in this sequence: 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 12, 14, 15, 16, 18, 20?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 21

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Musician
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, widow, everyone. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Purple Haze is a song by what famous musician?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimi Hendrix

questions.question: The Orlons had a 1963 hit in which they told everyone where all the hippies meet. Where was this, according to the song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Street

questions.question: What was the only Top 40 hit of musician, bandleader, and television impresario Lawrence Welk?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calcutta

questions.question: Which famous rock musician directed Born to Boogie a 1972 movie about English rock band T. Rex?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ringo Starr

questions.question: If I mix the following ingredients together, what drink would I have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cosmopolitan

questions.question: Who was/were the featured artist/group in Mad Dogs and Englishmen, a 1971 movie about an American music tour?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Cocker

questions.question: Which was the first song that radio personality and voice actor Casey Kasem played on his radio show Americas Top Forty?

options.text: Mama Told Me Not to Come

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mama Told Me Not to Come

questions.question: What famous singer encouraged his fans to come to his concerts dressed in the purple colour?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince

questions.question: Who wrote the book To Kill a Mockingbird?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harper Lee

questions.question: Which of the following groups of mammals lay eggs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monotremes

questions.question: James Madison was the 3rd U.S. President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is found in plant cells, but not in animal cells?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chloroplast

questions.question: In the Middle Ages, the purple color was used only for royal clothing because the dye was much more expensive than gold. What was the purple dye made from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mollusk

questions.question: In what country does a widow wear purple to mourn her husbands death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thailand

questions.question: The first recorded use of the word purple in the English language dates back to what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: AD 975

quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, shades. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How long is a fortnight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2 weeks

questions.question: Who played Elizabeth Brooke McGuire in the television show, Lizzie McGuire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hillary Duff

questions.question: Who portrayed Harry Potter in each film of the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Radcliffe

questions.question: What actor starred in the movies Billy Madison, Happy Gilmore, Big Daddy, Punch-Drunk Love, Spanglish, Click, and Reign Over Me?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam Sandler

questions.question: What famous news reporter was honored with the Purple Heart after he was killed by a Japanese sniper in 1945?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernie Pyle

questions.question: Who was actress Sheree Elizabeth Zampino married to from 1992 to 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Will Smith

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eva Longoria Parker

questions.question: Which of these shades of purple can be found in a box of Crayola Crayons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of the Above

questions.question: What actor is known for his comedic roles in the movies Wedding Crashers and Zoolander?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Owen Wilson

questions.question: Who wrote the book The Color Purple that was adapted into a Broadway play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alice Walker

questions.question: Who was drafted by the Orlando Magic as the 1st overall pick in the 1992 NBA draft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shaquille ONeal

questions.question: Who was drafted by the Houston Rockets in the first overall selection of the 1984 NBA draft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hakeem Olajuwon

questions.question: Who played the role of Draco Malfoy in the Harry Potter film series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Felton

questions.question: Titanium melts at 1941° on what temperature scale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kelvin

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pu

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Alabama and Team
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, ship, cotton. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who lost the Battle of Marathon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darius I

questions.question: What is the name of Titanics sister ship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Olympic

questions.question: What is an ordinal number?

options.text: A number that shows the number of elements in a set
A number that is less than zero

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A number that shows order

questions.question: It is the 1954 Cotton Bowl between Rice and Alabama.  Rices All-American running back, Dicky Moegle, is leading his team to a crushing of the Bart Starr led Alabama team.  On one run, he was stopped on his own 35 yard line, where he was tackled.  The referee blew his whistle and awarded a touchdown.  Why ?

options.text: The referee made a mistake on a penalty
He flipped the ball to another player who scored
He was tackled by Tommy Lewis

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was tackled by Tommy Lewis

questions.question: Former Emperor of Japan, Hirohito, was considered an expert in which of these subjects?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marine biology

questions.question: Which French phrase can mean tastes differ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chacun a son gout

questions.question: Who wrote the poem, In The Naked Bed, In Platos Cave
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Delmore Schwartz

questions.question: Dr. Mary Edwards Walker was the first American women to be awarded what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Congressional Medal of Honor

questions.question: How many pecks are there in a bushel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Historians often attribute Napoleons defeat at Waterloo to which of these reasons?

options.text: Wellington took a big risk and it paid off
Marshall Ney had special ties to Wellington and intentionally did not turn Wellingtons right flank

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these reasons

questions.question: Plato won it twice.  Aristotle, Socrates and Alexander the Great are all said to have been keen observers of it.  Dioxippus was probably the most famous winner of it.  What does this question refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A martial art championship

questions.question: Which is the most recent volcano formed in the Western Hemisphere ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paricutin

questions.question: About how many feet are there in one kilometer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3281

questions.question: During what year did Samuel Morse come up with the idea of Morse Code?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1838

questions.question: In 2006, it was confirmed that there are 9 planets in the Solar System.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Story and Place
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, ney, ship. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On May 28, 1875, 50 students from the Vicksburg High School heard a lady in distress screaming; Help me in the name of God, the men are hurting me. Since then, hundreds of people have reported hearing the same voice. With which event is this ghostly voice associated?

options.text: Indian retaliation for the desagration of an Ancient burial ground
The fall of Vicksburgh during the Civil War

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The vanishing of  a riverboat

questions.question: The famous Statue of Liberty lies between New York and New Jersey.  Another, much smaller Statue of Liberty of the same shape is located where?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris

questions.question: Prior to his rise to power in Spain, what was Francos job?

options.text: He was an Associate Professor at Spains College for Infantry Officers
He was in charge of Spains military bases in Morocco
He was in charge of the last Cavalry division in the history of the Spanish Army
He was in charge of the Quartermaster Corps of the Spanish Army

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was in charge of Spains military bases in Morocco

questions.question: Which if these most accurately describes the difference between the words farther and further?

options.text: Farther means more far and further means more to the fore.
Farther represents a greater distance than further.
There are no differences in use
Farther is used when a known direction is involved; further is in more general.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Farther means more far and further means more to the fore.

questions.question: Why was the battle of Huai-Hai so important in world history?

options.text: It was the  battle that gave control of China to the Mongols
It was the final battle that drove Japan out of China in WWII
It was the last major battle between Chinese Communists and Chinese Nationalists
It was the last major Chinese-aided attack of the Vietnam War

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was the last major battle between Chinese Communists and Chinese Nationalists

questions.question: Many sailors have seen the Flying Dutchman, a ship doomed to roam the seas forever. Where did the Flying Dutchman reportedly disappear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cape of Good Hope

questions.question: In Michael Curtizs movie, Casablanca, where were the visas to Portugal hidden ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In Sams piano

questions.question: Towards the beginning of the new millennium, who was the oldest person elected US President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reagan

questions.question: Which of these is a major difference between New World monkeys (Platyrrhines) and Old World Monkeys (Cercopithecidae)?

options.text: New World Monkeys can hang by their tail
Old world monkeys lack sitting pads.
Old World Monkeys have canines that can chew meat
New World monkeys can not walk on two legs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New World Monkeys can hang by their tail

questions.question: Francis Galton, half-cousin of Charles Darwin is credited with doing what, to tremendously help law enforcement agencies?

options.text: Using his knowledge of insects to tell times of death
Aiding in the capture of top British criminals
Being the first to use fingerprint  identification
Developing the earliest form of DNA testing

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Being the first to use fingerprint  identification

questions.question: The Lutz family - famous as the occupants of the infamous Amityville house - told their story to the writer Jay Anson, who turned it into a best-selling book. Later, a movie was made based on the supposed events that took place in this house. James Brolin played the role of the surveyour George Lutz. He became convinced that the film was jinxed. Did he experience his first haunting experience on the film set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: After the battle of Waterloo, General Ney of the French army received a death sentence and was reportedly executed by firing squad on December 7th, 1815. However a gentleman called Peter Ney, who died in the year 1846, claimed to be the General.  It was never proven that he actually was the General. However, many things point towards the truth of his claim. Which of thes is not one of them?

options.text: On the boat to the US he was spotted and recognized by a former soldier under his command
When he arrived in the US - safe from prosecution - he identified himself as the General, but he was not believed
A famous New York handwriting specialist identified his writing as that of the general
He had surprising knowledge of the family background and the military

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When he arrived in the US - safe from prosecution - he identified himself as the General, but he was not believed

questions.question: This place is haunted by a man,who was brutally murdered. During his lifetime he reportedly participated in seances to contact his dead son, William. The Dutch Queen Wilhelmina encountered this person in the middle of the night, when she was staying at what place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The White House

questions.question: The story of Atlantis dates all the way back to ancient Egypt. The story was first written down by the traveller Solon. But who wrote the only remaining story of the lost continent Atlantis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Plato

questions.question: This entity has been haunting the same area for over 260 years. In this period it has been witnessed 2,000 times. One of the famous eye witnesses - former Spanish King Joseph Bonaparte - saw this flying creature while out hunting. One popular theory is that the creature is the very essence of evil, embodied. What is the name of this creature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jersey Devil

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Year and Songs
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was originally selected to play Leo Bloom in the 1968 comedy film The Producers written by Mel Brooks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dustin Hoffman

questions.question: The line There is no Y in Egypt comes from which movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Five Graves to Cairo

questions.question: Tower Green - part of the Tower of London complex - is frequented by the ghost of Lady Salisbury. According to witnesses the last moments of her life are re-enacted in this part of the infamous Tower where she met her doom. How did lady Salisbury die?

options.text: She climbed up  jumped from the Tower

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was axed to death

questions.question: Which blood constituent is involved in the formation of blood clots but has a shelf-life of only 5 days?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: platelets

questions.question: This TV series, which aired in 1982-1983, starred Sarah Jessica Parker, Jami Gertz, Tracy Nelson, and Amy Linker.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Square Pegs

questions.question: Approximately how much whole milk does it take to make one gallon of ice cream?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12 pounds

questions.question: In what year did the Catholic Church split with the Orthodox Church?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1054

questions.question: In 1897, American scientist John Jacob Abel was able to isolate which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: adrenaline

questions.question: Rudolph Walter Wanderone Jr. was a famous player in what sport?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: pool

questions.question: This American actor appeared in the first X-Rated movie to be nominated for an Academy Award. His  brother wrote the songs Wild Thing and Angel of the Morning. Two of his children are actors. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jon Voight

questions.question: Elvis Presley, often referred to as the King of Rock and Roll, was born in which southern state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mississippi

questions.question: This country music singer known for his songs about family and religion, had his most success with song writing.  Writing songs such as Forever and Ever Amen by Randy Travis, When You Say Nothing At All by Keith Whitley and Love Can Build a Bridge by the Judds.  Who is this singer/songwriter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Overstreet

questions.question: Alexander Reid, a famous Scottish art dealer, lived with the Van Gogh brothers for over a year and was given two original Van Goghs as a farewell gift. He quickly sold both of them for five pounds. Why?

options.text: His father thought they were terrible
They were actually painted by Theo not by Vincent

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His father thought they were terrible

questions.question: The Five Positions, which are the basis of ballet, as well as the starting and ending points for ballet movements, were finally established by Pierre Rameau in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1725

questions.question: Every year in Yatesville, Georgia there is a celebration of chitlins, called the Chitlin Hoedown.  What exactly are chitlins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pigs intestines
